intro: Braya humilis var. laurentiana, commonly known as the Laurentian bladderwort, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to the arctic and alpine regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in tundra and alpine meadows. This species is adapted to cold climates and has a short growing season, flowering early in the summer.
